page.title: 12ANIMAL LIFE NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: Typical species of wildlife in the area:-badgers,stoats,weasels,grey squirrels,rabbits,deer,pheasants and partridges. Badgers are on the increase,as are grey squirrels. Myxomatosis is still prevelant in the rabbit population and this has caused a decline in the number of stoats and weasels.There has been a gradual change from Fallow Deer to Roe Deer in the area.The Roe Deer have adapted much better to the reduction in open grassland and increase in conifer planting. The loss of deciduous trees has caused a reduction in the number of owls in the area because of the reduced number of nesting sites. Buzzards,however,have adapted quite well to changing environment and are thought possibly to be on the increase.
